byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome, Katarina Johannsen from Berlin, Stanley Reed from London, and Elian Peltier from Paris.

abstract: European leaders are eager to begin trade relationship with Iran following lifting of sanctions under nuclear agreement, but venture poses significant risks, particularly in the event that Iran violates agreement; many American sanctions will remain in place, and trade relations between United States and Iran are unlikely to change drastically.
lead_paragraph: The rush to restart trade with Iran could make it more complicated to renew sanctions if the nuclear deal brokered by the United States falls apart.

headline.main: After Deal, Europeans Are Eager to Do Business in Iran
headline.print_headline: Europe Sees Ripe Market in Iran, Once Sanctions Go

snippet: The rush to restart trade with Iran could make it more complicated to renew sanctions if the nuclear deal brokered by the United States falls apart.
